events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the morning of June 1st, requesting to file a new claim for damages sustained.
Claim has been categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report describing the car collision and damage details.
An insurance agent was assigned to manage the auto accident claim and contact the claimant for further details.
Acknowledgement of the claim was sent to the customer, confirming receipt and intention to proceed with the assessment promptly.
Request was made for additional documents including the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and the insurance policy details.
The claimant submitted all requested documents, including the official police report and several photos showing the collision impact.
Investigation into the auto accident began to assess liability and verify the extent of vehicle damages reported by the claimant.
Investigation has been completed, confirming the car collision details and damage estimates provided align with submitted evidence.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant based on repair costs and coverage limits identified during investigation.
The claimant responded positively to the settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the prompt handling of the claim.
Following the claimant's acceptance, the insurance company approved the claim and finalized the compensation amount.
Payment was issued to the policyholder's designated bank account covering the agreed auto accident damages compensation.
The claim file was officially closed after all payments were processed and the claimant confirmed repairs were underway.
All claim documents and communications were archived securely for future reference and compliance with company policies.
